member.name: T:RichTextBoxControl.PasteMode
member.summary: Specifies the manner in which the editor handles pasted text. Use this option to specify if formatting is stripped when text is pasted into the editor.

member.name: F:RichTextBoxControl.PasteMode.Normal
member.summary: When you paste text into the editor it is not processed in any way.

member.name: F:RichTextBoxControl.PasteMode.StripFormatting
member.summary: When you paste text into the editor, all HTML formatting is stripped. This option is ideal for content management systems where you want absolute control over the formatting.

member.name: F:RichTextBoxControl.BreakMode.LineBreak
member.summary: Specifies that when the end-user presses the Return key in the editor a line-break (br tag) is inserted rather than a paragraph break (p tag)

member.name: F:RichTextBoxControl.BreakMode.ParagraphBreak
member.summary: Specifies that when the end-user presses the Return key in the editor a paragraph-break (p tag) is inserted into the document

member.name: T:RichTextBoxControl.TextChangedEventHandler
member.summary: This describes the event handler for when the text has changed.

member.name: T:RichTextBoxControl.SavedEventHandler
member.summary: This describes the event handler for when the text has saved.

summary.p: RichTextBox is an ASP.NET server control that works in much the same way as the standard TextBox control, but provides the ability for the user to edit the text using a variety of formatting options including bold, italic, underline, justification, hyperlinks, fonts and paragraph styles.
RichTextBox provides an easy way to implement formatted text editing on a web site and this documentation should provide everything you need to customise the control for your particular application.

remarks.p: RichTextBox is displayed in Internet Explorer 5 and later using an editable IFRAME and is implemented using several hundred lines of HTML and JavaScript which is generated depending on the configuration you have chosen using the methods and properties on the object.

As Internet Explorer is currently the only browser supporting this functionality, the formatted text editing is only available in Internet Explorer 5.0 and above. If the visitor to the site uses a different web browser (e.g. Navigator, or Opera) they will instead see a TEXTAREA displaying the HTML.

By default RichTextBox uses images for the buttons on the editor. To ensure these images are displayed correctly, copy the "images" folder provided with the control into your web site so that the "images" folder sits next to the page that implements the RichTextBox. If you want to relocate the images to another folder or site, you can do that using .

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.PasteAction
member.summary: Specifies how the editor behaves when the end-user pastes content into it using the Paste button, the Ctrl-V short-cut or the context menu. This property can be used to specify that all formatting is removed from pasted text, making it ideal for controlling the types of formatting you allow.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HtmlOutputChangeAbsoluteURLsToRelative
member.summary: By default Internet Explorer converts all URLs in hyperlinks (anchor tags) and images (img tags) to absolute URLs. When this property is set to true (the default) RichTextBox takes all URLs in the document and if the hostname in the URL matches the current hostname the URL is taken back to a relative URL.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HtmlOutputUseLowerCase
member.summary: By default Internet Explorer stores HTML in upper case. When this property is set to true (the default) RichTextBox moves all HTML tagnames and attribute names to lower case in line with the XHTML standard.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HtmlOutputUseNumericCharacterReferences
member.summary: When this property is set to true (the default) RichTextBox converts all non-7bit characters to numeric entities.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HtmlOutputStripJavaScript
member.summary: When this property is set to true (the default) RichTextBox strips all script elements and script contents from the html.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarLayout

summary.p: Configures which buttons and menus appear on the toolbar.
For example a minmimal toolbar that includes two rows of menus/buttons can be defined with this string: "bold,separator,italic:fontmenu,insertlink"
A (,) comma separates each toolbar item. A colon (:) separates each toolbar row. To insert a separator between items, use the "separator" identifier.

member.remarks: If you would like to see a list of all available Toolbar items

member.remarks: If the HTML option is displayed on the right of the RichTextBox the checkbox is displayed on the right side of the text, whereas normally it is displayed on the left of the checkbox.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarBorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style of border used around the outer edge of the toolbar.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarBorderWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the border around the outer edge of the toolbar

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the number of pixels of space applied around each toolbar button and menu. If this property is set to zero, all buttons and menus will butt up against one another.
member.remarks: This property defaults to 1.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.DownlevelRows
member.summary: Specifies the number of text rows used for the textarea that is displayed when the RichTextBox is displayed in browsers that do not support rich text editing.
member.remarks: This property has no effect on how RichTextBox is displayed in Internet Explorer 5 or later.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.DownlevelCols
member.summary: Specifies the number of text columns used for the textarea that is displayed when the RichTextBox is displayed in browsers that do not support rich text editing.
member.remarks: This property has no effect on how RichTextBox is displayed in Internet Explorer 5 or later.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.DownlevelMessage
member.summary: Specifies the message displayed to users of downlevel browsers if is set to false.

example.code: richtext1.DownlevelMessage = "To edit this document you must use Internet Explorer 5.0 or later";

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.DownlevelMode
member.summary: Specifies the message displayed to users of downlevel browsers if is set to false.

example.code: richtext1.DownlevelMessage = "To edit this document you must use Internet Explorer 5.0 or later";

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HtmlOptionTextCssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name used for the text of the HTML mode checkbox. By setting this property and creating an associated class in a stylesheet, it is possible to control how the text is displayed on the RichTextBox.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarAutoHideIsEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the toolbar should be hidden from view when the user enables HTML view. If this property is set to false, the toolbar will remain in view and an error will be displayed if the user tries to apply formatting to the HTML source.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarErrorText
member.summary: Specifies the error text displayed if the user clicks a button on the toolbar whilst in HTML mode. Note that this error can only occur if the ToolbarAutoHideIsEnabled property is set to false.

example.code: richtext1.ToolbarErrorText = "Please turn off HTML view and try again";

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ButtonCssClass
member.summary: Specifies the name of the CSS class used by the buttons on the toolbar.
member.remarks: This property is useful when you have configured the ButtonType property to use form buttons rather than images, and you want to control the look and feel of the form buttons, for example to use a smaller font size.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.MenuCssClass
member.summary: Specifies the name of the CSS class used by the menus on the toolbar.
member.remarks: This property is useful to ensure that the menus on the editor make use of any cascading styles that you have applied to form elements elsewhere in the web application. It is designed to allow much greater consistency.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HelpUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of the help page that opens when the user clicks the Help button on the toolbar
member.remarks: To enable the Help button, use .

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarSeparatorImageWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width in pixels of the image used as a separator in the toolbar.
member.remarks: This property has no effect if is set to Button.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ToolbarSeparatorImageHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height in pixels of the image used as a separator in the toolbar.
member.remarks: This property has no effect if is set to Button.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ButtonRolloversAreEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the rollovers on the image buttons. If this property is set to false, the image buttons do not change when the mouse pointer moves over them.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.Name
member.summary: This property is an alias for the ID property and performs exactly the same function.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.TextPlain
member.summary: Returns the text in the editable area, but with all HTML tags removed so it is human readable as plain text.
member.remarks: If you want to store the document text in a database which is searchable, you can use the output of this property to create an HTML-free copy for indexing.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.EnableViewState

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.FontColorNames

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.SymbolsList
member.summary: Specifies the XHTML entity codes for the items on the Symbols menu.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ParagraphList
member.summary: This property provides customisation for the Paragraph menu on the RichTextBox. The property is set of strings listing paragraph formatting types coming from this set : "<body>,<h1>,<h2>,<h3>,<h4>,<h5>,<h6>,<dir>,<menu>,<pre>,<address>"

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.Font
member.summary: This property is provided by .Net, but has no effect on RichTextBox

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ForeColor
member.summary: This property is provided by .Net, but has no effect on RichTextBox

summary.p: Specifies the names used to describe each of the paragraph styles in the Paragraph menu. The number of items in this array will generally be the same as the number in the ParagraphList property as there is a one-to-one mapping between the two.
For example, using this property you can ensure that when "Heading 1" is available on the Paragraph menu, it is displayed as "Main Heading" rather than "Heading 1".

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ImageList
member.summary: This property provides customisation for the Image menu on RichTextBox. The property is set of strings listing image filenames, e.g. "logo.gif", "photo1.jpg", "chart4.gif". From ASPX page, just comma separate each filename.

summary.p: Specifies the names used to describe each of the images in the Image menu. The number of items in this array will generally be the same as the number in the ImageList property as there is a one-to-one mapping between the two.
For example, using this property you can ensure that when "logo.gif" is available on the Image menu, it is displayed as "Company logo" rather than "logo.gif".

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.StyleNames
member.summary: Specifies the names of the CSS styles displayed in the Style menu.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.StyleList
member.summary: Specifies the CSS styles that appear in the Style menu

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.FontList
member.summary: This property provides customisation for the Fonts menu on the RichTextBox. The property is a string containing a comma-delimited list of fonts coming from this set : "Arial,Comic Sans MS,Courier New,Tahoma,Times New Roman,Verdana"

example.code: myRichTextBox.FontList = new string[] {"Comic Sans MS", "Courier New"};

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.FontSizeList
member.summary: This property provides customisation for the Font Size menu on the RichTextBox. The property is a string containing a comma-delimited list of font sizes coming from this set : "1,2,3,4,5,6"

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ButtonImagePath
member.summary: Specifies the absolute or relative URL path to the folder that contains the images to be used for the image buttons.

remarks.p: This property defaults to looking for button images at the relative path "~/images/standard/"
If you want to specify the location of the images on the Image menu,
You can specify the default ButtonImagePath in web.config by adding a line like this to the appSettings section:

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.EmoticonImagePath
member.summary: Specifies the absolute or relative URL path to the folder that contains the images to be used for the emoticons.

remarks.p: This property defaults to looking for emoticon images at the relative path http://www.asp.net/Forums/skins/default/images/emotions/

member.summary: Sets the color of the background for the toolbar area.

member.summary: Sets the color of the background for the area occupied by the HTML checkbox. This area stretches from the left all the way across to the right.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the RichTextBox control on the page.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the RichTextBox control on the page.
member.remarks: This value specifies the height of the entire control, not just the editable area. This means that when the user puts the control into HTML View mode and the toolbar disappears the control does not resize.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.HtmlOptionIsEnabled
member.summary: When this property is set to true, the toolbar includes an item that allows the user to turn on HTML view where they can edit the HTML of the text directly. If you want to prevent the user editing HTML directly, set this property to false.
member.remarks: This property also specifies what happens in a downlevel browser. If it is set to false, a message is displayed to users of downlevel browsers and they are unable to edit the HTML. The message can be altered using .

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.Focus
member.summary: Specifies whether the editor grabs focus when the page loads. If this property is set to true then the editor will take focus, if it is set to false it will not.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.ButtonType
member.summary: If this property is set to true, the buttons on the boolbar are displayed using bitmap images. If it is set to false, the toolbar buttons are rendered using HTML form buttons, and thereby avoiding the need for image files.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.Text
member.summary: This property provides access to the text within the editable area of the RichTextBox control. It can be used to set the text when the control is first displayed and also to read out the text when a form has been submitted. To specify the type of HTML that is output use the properties that start HtmlOutputxxx.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.TextRaw

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.UICultureBehavior
member.summary: This property sets the behavior for determining how the current culture is chosen for the RichTextBox

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.RichEditingIsAvailable
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the editor will provide rich-text editing. This property returns true if the end-user loads the page using Internet Explorer 5.0 or later running on Windows or Mozilla 1.3 or later. You can alter how the editor behaves in downlevel browsers using . If the ClientTarget attribute on the @Page declaration has been set, this property will determine browser capabilities from the ClientTarget setting and machine.config, rather than the capabilities of the current web browser. For example, if ClientTarget="Uplevel" is specified, then ASP.Net 1.0 and 1.1 work as though the browser is Internet Explorer 4. Rich-text editing with RichTextBox is only designed to support Internet Explorer 5 and above and therefore will always render with rich-text editing disabled.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.IsIE
member.summary: This property returns true if the end-user loads the page using Internet Explorer.

member.name: P:RichTextBoxControl.RichTextBox.IsSupported
member.summary: This property returns true if the end-user loads the page using browser with JS>=3.0

member.name: F:RichTextBoxControl.ToolbarMenu.OnChange
member.summary: Specifies the client-side function that fires when the a menu item is selected. This property specifies just the script function name, so you must also create a script function with that same name. It must accept parameters as follows: function FunctionName(editor,isInHtmlMode,text,value) The first parameter is the iframe object that contains the document. The second parameter is a boolean indicating whether the editor is in HTML mode. The third parameter is the text of the menu item (the one the user sees in the menu). The fourth parameter is the actual value of the menu item.
